p: The infections by rhinovirus may be triggering factors of exacerbations of asthma, probably because they induce inflammation in airways that are already damaged and sensitized. Rhinoviruses were detected by RT-PCR among infants (von Mutius, 2004), in the acute exacerbation of asthma when infection was prolonged (Tsukagoshi et al., 2013). Some authors describe that bronchial epithelial patient cells with asthma are more effectively infected with RV than normal epithelia. It was shown that viral are upregulated in the epithelial cells of patients with allergies (Canonica et al., 1995; Tantilipikorn and Auewarakul, 2011).
